an9.52:1.2: In what way did the Buddha speak of a safe place?”
an9.52:2.1: “First, take a mendicant who, quite secluded from sensual pleasures … enters and remains in the first absorption.
an9.52:2.2: To this extent the Buddha spoke of a safe place in a qualified sense. …
an9.52:3.1: Furthermore, take a mendicant who, going totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, enters and remains in the cessation of perception and feeling. And, having seen with wisdom, their defilements come to an end.
an9.52:3.2: To this extent the Buddha spoke of a safe place in a definitive sense.”
